Title.evidence: This study describes occult lesion clinical data and evaluates characteristics so that surgeons can better incorporate this emerging technology into clinical decision making.

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants (n = 100) enrolled in a phase 3 trial of IMI with pafolacianine during pulmonary resection

Participants.evidence: Participants (n = 100) enrolled in a phase 3 trial of IMI with pafolacianine during pulmonary resection

Intervention.evidence: phase 3 trial of IMI with pafolacianine during pulmonary resection

Objective.evidence: This study describes occult lesion clinical data and evaluates characteristics so that surgeons can better incorporate this emerging technology into clinical decision making.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Participants (n = 100) enrolled in a phase 3 trial

Result_Outcome.evidence: IMI identified 29 occult lesions in 23 (23%) participants.

Harms.evidence: There was no additional morbidity in participants with lesions resected.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Enabling Lung Cancer Identification Using Folate Receptor Targeting [ELUCIDATE]; NCT04241315
